monster.name: Cerebrax
monster.resistance: poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The cerebrax has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Mind Armor
trait.text: The cerebrax has a psionic field around itself that gives it an AC of 16.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
trait.text: The cerebrax’s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: detect thoughts, levitate, minor illusion
3/day: hypnotic pattern, misty step
1/day: see invisibility, shield

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 2–3)
action.text: The cerebrax magically emits psychic energy in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 16 Intelligence saving throw or take 13 (2d8 + 4) psychic damage. If the creature(s) are spellcasters and fail the save, the cerebrax also drains three spell slots below 4th level. It gains 10 temporary hit points each time it drains spell slots from a creature.

monster.spells: detect thoughts, levitate, minor illusion, hypnotic pattern, misty step, see invisibility, shield
monster.description:
The first monsters that entered the world through Riftgates were the cerebrax. They are from another world ruled entirely by psionic creatures. Oswald’s disruption of the fabric of time and space was quickly noticed by these creatures. They brought a strange curse with them and began to search for magic.
Magic Hunters. These aberrations hunt spellcasters and drain their powers. This process fuels the psionic monsters. Having searched the multiverse for magical power they were very pleased to have found Oswald’s world.
Mind Control. Cerebrax are insane, foul beings. They want to eventually take over the entire multiverse. The aberrations know they can’t compete with powerful spellcasters like Oswald, so lesser magic-users are their usual targets.
Neural Network. Cerebrax can communicate with others of their kind, even through portals like Riftgates. They share a hive mind where they can access each others’ memories.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness p. 7 (ThirdParty)

monster.name: Oswald Myrr

trait.name: Master Transmuter
trait.text: Oswald can use an action to consume the reserve of transmutation magic stored within his transmuter’s stone in a single burst. When he does so, he can choose on of the following effects. His transmuter’s stone is destroyed and can’t be remade until he finishes a long rest.

Major Transformation. He can transmute one nonmagical object-no larger than a 5-foot cube-into another nonmagical object of similar size and mass and of equal or lesser value. He must spend 10 minutes handling the object to transform it.
Panacea. He removes all curses, diseases, and poisons affecting a creature that he touches with the transmuter’s stone. The creature also regains all its hit points.
Restore Life. He casts the raise dead spell on a creature he touches with the transmuter’s stone, without expending a spell slot or needing to have the spell in his spell book.

Restore Youth. He touches the transmuter’s stone to a willing creature, and that creature’s apparent age is reduced by 3d10 years, to a minimum of 13 years. This effect doesn’t extend the creature’s lifespan.

trait.name: Minor Alchemy
trait.text: He can temporarily alter the physical properties of one nonmagical object, changing it from one substance to another. He performs a special alchemical procedure on one object composed entirely of wood, stone (but not a gemstone), iron, copper, or silver, transforming it into a different one of those materials. For each 10 minutes he spends performing the procedure, he can transform up to 1 cubic foot of material. After 1 hour, or until he loses his concentration, the material reverts to its original substance.

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: He can cast the polymorph spell without expending a spell slot. When he does so, he can only target himself and transform into a beast whose challenge rating is 1 or lower. Once he casts polymorph in this way, he can’t do so again until he finishes a short or long rest.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Oswald is a 20th-level wizard. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 23, +15 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, message, prestidigitation
1st level (4 slots): expeditious retreat, feather fall, longstrider, magic missile, shield
2nd level (3 slots): alter self, darkvision, invisibility, misty step, scorching ray, spider climb
3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fireball, gaseous form, haste, meld into stone, water breathing
4th level (3 slots): fabricate, polymorph, stone shape
5th level (3 slots): animate objects, control wind, modify memory, passwall, raise dead
6th level (2 slots): flesh to stone, wind walk
7th level (2 slots): etherealness, reverse gravity
8th level (1 slot): control weather, mind blank
9th level (1 slot): gate

action.name: Staff of Myrr
action.text: Melee Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d12 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 22 (5d8) force damage.

monster.spells: fire bolt, light, mage hand, message, prestidigitation, expeditious retreat, feather fall, longstrider, magic missile, shield, alter self, darkvision, invisibility, misty step, scorching ray, spider climb, counterspell, fireball, gaseous form, haste, meld into stone, water breathing, fabricate, polymorph, stone shape, animate objects, control wind, modify memory, passwall, raise dead, flesh to stone, wind walk, etherealness, reverse gravity, control weather, mind blank, gate
monster.description:
Oswald Myrr is a legendary wizard and a new member of the Alliance of the Griffon. Some call him the Wizard of Zogg, after his homeland. Oswald currently lives in a secret woodland manor on the continent of Naern. The people of Zogg and Myrr believe the wizard died 500 years ago. However, he is still alive and on a path of redemption. Long ago he was banished from the Wizard Council for his hazardous experiments. After causing so much turmoil, the ancient mage has joined the Alliance to try to make things right. He usually rides a pegasus as his mount.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness p. 147 (ThirdParty)

monster.name: Mary Myrr, Night Hag
monster.resistance: cold, fire; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Mary has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Mary’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: chill touch, detect magic, magic missile, minor illusion
2/day each: hypnotic pattern, misty step, plane shift (self only), ray of enfeeblement, scorching ray (3rd level), sleep, vampiric touch (4th level)
1/day each: banishment, darkness, dispel magic, fog cloud, modify memory

action.name: Claws (Hag Form Only)
action.text: Melee Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 22 (5d8) necrotic damage.

action.name: Change Shape
action.text: Mary magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium female humanoid, or back into her true form. Her statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying is transformed. She reverts to her true form if she dies.

action.name: Etherealness
action.text: Mary magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. To do so, she must have a heartstone in her possession.

action.name: Nightmare Haunting (1/Day)
action.text: While on the Ethereal Plane, Mary magically touches a sleeping humanoid on the Material Plane. A protection from evil and good spell cast on the target prevents this contact, as does a magic circle. As long as the contact persists, the target has dreadful visions. If these visions last for at least 1 hour, the target gains no benefit from its rest, and its hit point maximum is reduced by 5 (1d10). If this effect reduces the target’s hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and if the target was evil, its soul is trapped in the hag’s soul bag. The reduction to the target’s hit point maximum lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or similar magic.

monster.spells: chill touch, detect magic, magic missile, minor illusion, hypnotic pattern, misty step, plane shift, ray of enfeeblement, scorching ray, sleep, vampiric touch, banishment, darkness, dispel magic, fog cloud, modify memory
monster.description:
Oswald’s mother is a horrid, insane night hag. She fell in love with Edmund Myrr and was heartbroken when their marriage ended.
Mad Hag. When Mary lost her mind, she began to wander into other worlds. On her journey she headed further and further down a dark path.
Smother Mother. She could never leave her son alone as he grew. Mary became obsessed with the talented Oswald. This behavior drove her gifted son to leave and never return.
Lost Love. At the core of her madness is a broken heart. Her husband didn’t just leave her, he didn’t love her anymore. While Edmund quickly forgot about his wife, she could never get over him.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness p. 148 (ThirdParty)

monster.name: Edmund Myrr, Lich King
monster.immune: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.languages: Common, Abyssal, Draconic, Elvish, Giant, Infernal

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Edmund fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
trait.text: If he has his phylactery, he gains a new body in 1d6 days, regaining all of his hit points and becoming alive again. The new body appears within 120 feet of the phylactery.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: Edmund has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Edmund is a 20th-level wizard. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 23, +15 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): chill touch, fire bolt, mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost
1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, shield, thunderwave
2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, invisibility, mirror image
3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, counterspell, dispel magic, fireball
4th level (3 slots): blight, dimension door, ice storm
5th level (3 slots): cloudkill, contagion, scrying
6th level (2 slots): create undead, disintegrate, globe of invulnerability
7th level (2 slots): finger of death, plane shift
8th level (1 slot): dominate monster, power word stun
9th level (1 slot): power word kill

action.name: Void Staff
action.text: Melee Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 22 (5d8) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Frightening Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Edmund fixes his gaze on one creature he can see within 10 feet of him. The target must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to Edmund’s gaze for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Disrupt Life (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Each non-undead creature within 30 feet of Edmund must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 35 (10d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.spells: chill touch, fire bolt, mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost, detect magic, magic missile, shield, thunderwave, detect thoughts, invisibility, mirror image, animate dead, counterspell, dispel magic, fireball, blight, dimension door, ice storm, cloudkill, contagion, scrying, create undead, disintegrate, globe of invulnerability, finger of death, plane shift, dominate monster, power word stun, power word kill
monster.description:
Edmund Myrr is Oswald’s father, a broken and disillusioned wizard who turned to the dark side and became a lich.
Dark Path. Fed up with the restrictions of the Wizard Council, Edmund took drastic action. He met with necromancers from the Void and threw himself off Grim Rock. Then the evil spellcasters helped him return to the world as a Lich King. Over a short period of time, Edmund took his place as one of the seven undead Kings of the Void.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness p. 149 (ThirdParty)

monster.name: Coroctopus

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: While out of water, the coroctopus can hold its breath for 2 hours.

trait.name: Underwater Coral Camouflage
trait.text: The coroctopus has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while underwater or anywhere near coral or rocks.

trait.name: Water Breathing
trait.text: The coroctopus can breathe underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The coroctopus makes two attacks with its tentacles.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is also grappled (escape DC 17). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the coroctopus can't use its tentacles on another target.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness Ocean, p. 15 ThirdParty

monster.name: The Ragnar

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The Ragnar has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the Ragnar fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The Ragnar does double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Ragnar makes one bite attack and two slam attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Swat Away
legendary.text: The Ragnar makes a slam attack. If the attack hits, the target must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet in a straight line away from the Ragnar. If the saving throw fails by 8 or more, the target falls prone.

legendary.name: Tail Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Bite Attack (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: The Ragnar makes a bite attack.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Varga the Ice Witch

trait.name: Arcane Ward
trait.text: When she casts an abjuration spell of 1st level or higher, she can simultaneously use a strand of the spell’s magic to create a magical ward on herself that lasts until she finishes a long rest. The ward has 39 hit points. Whenever she takes damage, the ward takes the damage instead. If this damage reduces the ward to 0 hit points, she takes any remaining damage. While the ward has 0 hit points, it can’t absorb damage, but its magic remains. Whenever she casts an abjuration spell of 1st level or higher, the ward regains a number of hit points equal to twice the level of the spell. Once she creates the ward, she can’t create it again until she finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Improved Abjuration
trait.text: When she casts an abjuration spell that requires her to make an ability check as a part of casting that spell, she adds +5 to that ability check.

trait.name: Projected Ward
trait.text: When a creature that she can see within 30 feet of her takes damage, she can use her reaction to cause her Arcane Ward to absorb that damage. If this damage reduces the ward to 0 hit points, the warded creature takes any remaining damage.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Varga is a 16th level wizard. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). She can cast the following spells:
Cantrips (at will): blade ward, dancing lights, minor illusion, ray of frost, resistance
1st level (4 slots): mage armor, protection from evil and good, shield, witch bolt
2nd level (3 slots): darkvision, misty step, see invisibility
3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, dispel magic, glyph of warding, nondetection
4th level (3 slots): banishment, confusion, ice storm
5th level (3 slots): cone of cold, planar binding
6th level (2 slots): globe of invulnerability
7th level (2 slots): etherealness, reverse gravity
8th level (1 slot): control weather

trait.name: Spell Resistance
trait.text: She has advantage on saving throws against spells. Furthermore, she has resistance against the damage of spells.

action.name: Ice Staff
action.text: Melee Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 22 (5d8) cold damage.

monster.spells: blade ward, dancing lights, minor illusion, ray of frost, resistance, mage armor, protection from evil and good, shield, witch bolt, darkvision, misty step, see invisibility, counterspell, dispel magic, glyph of warding, nondetection, banishment, confusion, ice storm, cone of cold, planar binding, globe of invulnerability, etherealness, reverse gravity, control weather
monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Ice Dragon

trait.name: Ice Walk
trait.text: The dragon can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn’t cost it extra movement.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Freezing Breath
action.text: The dragon exhales an icy breath in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) cold damage on a failure half damage on a success. If the target fails their saving throw, they are also paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw to end the paralysis at the end of each of their turns.

action.name: Frightful Presence
action.text: Each creature of the dragon’s choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Detect
legendary.text: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage.

legendary.name: Claw Attack (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: The dragon makes one claw attack.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Norvan, King Harald

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: The Norvan has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Action Surge (1/day)
trait.text: Harald can take an extra action.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/day)
trait.text: Harald can reroll a failed saving throw.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
trait.text: As a bonus action, he can regain 20 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Harald makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Hammer of the North
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (2d4) cold damage.

action.name: Battle Cry (2/day)
action.text: Each creature of Harald’s choice that is within 30 feet of him, can hear him, and not already affected by Battle Cry gain advantage on attack rolls until the start of Harald’s next turn. He can then make one attack as a bonus action.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Norvan, Shaman

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: The Norvan has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Frostskin (2/day)
trait.text: The shaman creates a magical hard frost on their skin which increases their AC to 14 for 1 minute.

trait.name: Iron Will
trait.text: The shaman has advantage on saving throws against being charmed.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
trait.text: The shaman has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The shaman is a 10th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The shaman has the following spells:
Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, guidance, produce flame, shillelagh
1st level (4 slots): animal friendship, beast sense, cure wounds, speak with animals
2nd level (3 slots): animal restoration, darkvision, lesser restoration, pass without trace
3rd level (3 slots): feign death, sleet storm, wind wall
4th level (3 slots): confusion, ice storm, freedom of movement
5th level (2 slots): reincarnate, scrying

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Change Shape (1/day)
action.text: The shaman magically polymorphs into a beast with a CR of 3 or less, and can remain in this form for up to 6 hours. The shaman can choose whether their equipment falls to the ground, melds with their new form, or is worn by the new form. The shaman reverts to their true form if they die or fall unconscious. The shaman can revert to their true form using a bonus action on their turn.

While in a new form, the shaman retains their game statistics and ability to speak, but their AC, movement modes, Strength, and Dexterity are replaced by those of the new form, and they gain any special senses, proficiencies, traits, actions, and reactions that the new form has but that they lack.

monster.spells: druidcraft, guidance, produce flame, shillelagh, animal friendship, beast sense, cure wounds, speak with animals, animal restoration, darkvision, lesser restoration, pass without trace, feign death, sleet storm, wind wall, confusion, ice storm, freedom of movement, reincarnate, scrying
monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Norvan, Soldier

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: The Norvan has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

action.name: Greataxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Voth

trait.name: Devil’s Sight
trait.text: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the voth's darkvision.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The voth has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put it to sleep.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The voth’s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks). The voth can innately cast the following spells:
At will: ray of frost

action.name: Adamantine Sword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) cold damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) cold damage.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Voth, Blizzard Wizard

trait.name: Devil’s Sight
trait.text: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the voth's darkvision.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The voth has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put it to sleep.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The voth’s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The voth can innately cast the following spells:
At will: chill touch, ray of frost
1/day each: fog cloud

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The voth is a 7th level wizard. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The voth can cast the following spells:
Cantrips (at will): chill touch, dancing lights, message, minor illusion
1st level (slots): charm person, feather fall, mage armor, ray of sickness
2nd level (slots): gust of wind, misty step, suggestion
3rd level (slots): animate dead, lightning bolt, sleet storm
4th level (slots): ice storm

action.name: Frost Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (2d4) cold damage.

monster.spells: chill touch, ray of frost, fog cloud, chill touch, dancing lights, message, minor illusion, charm person, feather fall, mage armor, ray of sickness, gust of wind, misty step, suggestion, animate dead, lightning bolt, sleet storm, ice storm
monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Voth, Vothlock

trait.name: Devil’s Sight
trait.text: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the vothlock's darkvision.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The vothlock has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put it to sleep.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The vothlock’s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The vothlock can innately cast the following spells:
At will: chill touch, mage armor (self only), ray of frost
1/day each: bestow curse, slow

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The vothlock is a 7th-level warlock. Their spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It regains expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. The vothlock knows the following spells:
Cantrips (at will): eldritch blast, minor illusion, prestidigitation, shocking grasp
1st–4th level (3 4th-level slots): counterspell, enthrall, hellish rebuke, invisibility, suggestion, vampiric touch

action.name: Ice Mace
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage and 7 (2d6) cold damage.

action.name: Summon Devil (1/day)
action.text: The vothlock can use an action to summon an imp. It appears in an occupied space within 30 feet of the vothlock. The imp obeys the vothlock for one hour and then dies. It is reborn in Hell with the knowledge of its summoning.

monster.spells: chill touch, mage armor, ray of frost, bestow curse, slow, eldritch blast, minor illusion, prestidigitation, shocking grasp, counterspell, enthrall, hellish rebuke, invisibility, suggestion, vampiric touch
monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Voth, King Vuthar

trait.name: Devil’s Sight
trait.text: Magical darkness doesn’t impede his darkvision.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Vuthar has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put him to sleep.

trait.name: Hellish Weapons
trait.text: Vuthar’s weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Vuthar’s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells:
At will: chill touch, ray of frost
1/day each: fog cloud

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Vuthar is a 15th-level wizard. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). He can cast the following spells:
Cantrips (at will): dancing lights, message, ray of frost, shocking grasp
1st level (4 slots): charm person, feather fall, ray of sickness
2nd level (3 slots): gust of wind, misty step, suggestion
3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, lightning bolt, sleet storm
4th level (3 slots): blight, dimension door, ice storm
5th level (2 slots): animate objects, cone of cold
6th level (2 slots): chain lightning, create undead
7th level (1 slot): finger of death
8th level (1 slot): control weather

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Vuthar makes three attacks.

action.name: Greatsword of Hell
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 5 (4d4) cold damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage and 2 (1d4) cold damage.

monster.spells: chill touch, ray of frost, fog cloud, dancing lights, message, ray of frost, shocking grasp, charm person, feather fall, ray of sickness, gust of wind, misty step, suggestion, animate dead, lightning bolt, sleet storm, blight, dimension door, ice storm, animate objects, cone of cold, chain lightning, create undead, finger of death, control weather
monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Crystal Spider

trait.name: Frozen Climber
trait.text: The crystal spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down in icy and snowy areas, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
trait.text: The crystal spider has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in icy or snowy terrain.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The crystal spider does double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The crystal spider makes two attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) cold damage.

action.name: Freezing Secretion
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/80 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage, and target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Swarm of Spiders
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

trait.name: Swarm
trait.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Frozen Climber
trait.text: The young crystal spider swarm can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down in icy or snowy areas, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
trait.text: The young crystal spider swarm has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in icy or snowy terrain.

action.name: Bites
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. 10 (4d4) piercing damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

monster.description: The Nature of Swarms. ------ The swarms presented here aren't ordinary or benign assemblies of little creatures. They form as a result of some sinister or unwholesome influence. A vampire can summon swarms of bats and rats from the darkest corners of the night, while the very presence of a mummy lord can cause scarab beetles to boil up from the sand-filled depths of its tomb. A hag might have the power to turn swarms of ravens against her enemies, while a yuan-ti abomination might have swarms of poisonous snakes slithering in its wake. Even druids can't charm these swarms, and their aggressiveness is borderline unnatural. ------ Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Icebreaker

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The ice breaker can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
trait.text: The ice breaker has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The ice breaker does double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (4d10 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the ice breaker can’t bite another target.

action.name: Swallow
action.text: The ice breaker makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the ice breaker, and it takes 9 (2d8) acid damage at the start of each of the ice breaker’s turns. The ice breaker can have only one target swallowed at a time.

If the ice breaker takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the ice breaker must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the ice breaker. If the ice breaker dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting prone.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Mammoth, Undead

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The undead mammoth does double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
trait.text: If the undead mammoth moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces the undead mammoth to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the undead mammoth drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Stomp
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Nordak

trait.name: Heated Body
trait.text: The nordak has a very warm inner temperature. If their stomachs are cut open, heat from their innards can keep a humanoid warm for eight hours. Of course, the nordak won’t survive the injury.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The nordak has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Animal
trait.text: The nordak can carry 200 lbs. of equipment.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Ozlog

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the ozlog moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The ozlog has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the ozlog’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: People of the Sky
monster.resist: acid, cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, poisoned, prone, restrained

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement (Light Form)
trait.text: The people of the sky can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. They take 5 (1d10) force damage if they end their turn inside an object.

trait.name: Northern Light Form
trait.text: The people of the sky can use an action to change their form into pure light or back into their true form. All their statistics remain the same, except their AC is 17 and they have the incorporeal movement trait. They revert back into their fey form if they are killed. People of the sky often choose vivid colors for their light form such as bright blue, pink, purple, yellow, and green.

trait.name: Open Riftgate
trait.text: The people of the sky can open Riftgates at will. However, the Riftgate must already be in place as they can’t create them.

action.name: Cold Blast
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) cold damage.

action.name: Lure of the Lights
action.text: Once a Riftgate is open, the people of the sky can attempt to lure targets into the gate. They send out a pattern of blue and green lights and any creatures within 100 feet must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. If a target fails their saving throw, they are compelled to follow the light patterns into the Riftgate.
If this action fails to lure the target, the people of the sky will speak directly to the creature and attempt to persuade them.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Polar Bear, Armored

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The armored polar bear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Animal
trait.text: Armored polar bears can carry at least 300 pounds of gear.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The armored polar bear makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: Iron Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: The Shapeshifter
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster.languages: the languages of the form it has assumed

trait.name: Ambusher
trait.text: In the first round of a combat, the shapeshifter has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprises.

trait.name: Assume Form
trait.text: The shapeshifter can assume the appearance of any Medium (or smaller) humanoid or beast it has eaten. It also feels and sounds exactly like the victim, speaking the languages it knows. Only a successful DC 18 Wisdom (Insight) check will reveal it to be a fake.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The shapeshifter has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The shapeshifter regains 10 hit points at the beginning of each of its turns. It is only destroyed if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The shapeshifter can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The shapeshifter can make one attack with its bite and two attacks with tendrils that emerge from inside its body.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) piercing damage.

action.name: Tendrils
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Aversion to Fire
reaction.text: If it can, the shapeshifter will use its reaction to move 10 feet away from any fire source.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Snogre

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The snogre has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The snogre makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its club.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

action.name: Ice Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Yarr Beak
monster.languages: understands Auran but can't speak it

trait.name: Agile Aviators
trait.text: The Yarr beak ignores any effects from high winds, blizzards, and storms.

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The Yarr beak has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
trait.text: The Yarr beak has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in icy or snowy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Yarr beak makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Arctic, p. ...)

monster.name: Giant Sand Shark

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the giant sand shark fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The giant sand shark deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The giant sand shark has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Tunneler
trait.text: The giant sand shark can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 43 (6d10 + 10) piercing damage. If the target is Large or smaller it must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the giant sand shark. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the giant sand shark, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the giant sand shark’s turns. If the giant sand shark takes 40 or more damage in one turn from a creature inside it, the giant sand shark must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone within 10 feet of the giant sand shark. If the giant sand shark dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

legendary.name: Detect
legendary.text: The giant sand shark makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Bite Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The giant sand shark makes a bite attack.

legendary.name: Move (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: The giant sand shark moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Desert, p. ...)

monster.name: Arthrop

trait.name: Crystal Clarity
trait.text: The arthrop has crystals embedded inside it. These crystals enable it to speak and give immunity against any charm magic.

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The arthrop has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The arthrop has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the arthrop's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The arthrop makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 1 poison damage.

action.name: Sand Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., range 30/70 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 1 poison damage, or 8 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 1 poison damage if used with two claws to make a melee attack.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Desert, p. ...)

monster.name: Bog Hopper

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The bog hopper can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
trait.text: The bog hopper has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The bog hopper has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Slippery
trait.text: The bog hopper has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The bog hopper's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the bog hopper has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
trait.text: If the bog hopper surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
trait.text: The bog hopper has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The bog hopper makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its horn.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Horn
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Shoot Spikes
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 30/80 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) poison damage.

reaction.name: Dodge
reaction.text: The bog hopper adds 1 to its AC against one melee attack. To do so, the bog hopper must be able to see the attacker.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Swamp/Jungle, p. ...)

monster.name: Jackalops

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the jackalops moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
trait.text: The jackalops can use a bonus action to take the Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The jackalops has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the jackalops' allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The jackalops’ long jump is up to 15 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Telepathic Ray
trait.text: The jackalops uses a green telepathic ray from its eye to communicate with other jackalopses.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The jackalops makes two melee attacks: one bite and one ram attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Eye Ray
action.text: The jackalops can target one creature within 60 feet of it with a red eye ray. The targeted creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (3d6) force damage.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Hills/Lakes, p. ...)

monster.name: Grim Roc

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The grim roc has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Turn Defiance
trait.text: The grim roc has advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the grim roc has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The shadow rabbit makes two attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: . Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Dark Egg
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 30/80 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) necrotic damage.

monster.description: Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness (Mountains, p. ...)
